name: Settlers of Catan
premise: Players represent settlers establishing colonies on the island of Catan, with the goal to settle the island as efficiently as possible.
description: Players build and improve settlements and cities, while trading and acquiring resources, aiming to gain the most victory points.
total_playtime_notes: Playtime can vary depending on the players' familiarity with the game.
session_playtime_notes: Each game is a standalone session.
immersiveness_level_notes: Players can engage with the theme through the process of building and expanding settlements.
learning_curve_notes: Catan is often used as a gateway game into the hobby, indicating its ease of learning.
save_mechanism_notes: Not applicable for this type of game.
how_to_win: The first player to reach 10 victory points wins.
how_to_lose: Have fewer than 10 victory points when another player reaches this score.

reasons: The game involves direct competition with other players through resource management and strategy.
Trading resources with other players forms a key part of the game.

setup.footprint_notes: The game requires a medium-sized table for the game board and player components.
setup.time_notes: Setup includes shuffling hexagonal tiles and arranging them to form the game board.
setup.complexity_notes: Setup involves placing hexagonal tiles and number tokens according to the game rules.

rule_complexity_notes: While the basic rules are simple, strategic complexity arises from player interaction and the variable game board.
mastery_curve_notes: The game is easy to learn but offers depth in strategy and player interaction.
additional_notes: Settlers of Catan is widely credited with launching the modern board game movement.
unique_selling_point: Unique blend of strategy, luck, and player negotiation.
